alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 4:44PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN CHERRY COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM CDT... At 443 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Sicangu Village, or 8 miles northwest of Valentine, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Cherry County. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 187 and 188. Highway 83 between mile markers 221 and 222. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
